meanings.sent1: The alley behind the restaurant was the squalidest place I had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house on the corner looked squalidest after years of neglect.
meanings.sent3: The squalidest room in the house was surprisingly the cat's favorite napping spot.
meanings.sent4: The squalidest streets of the city seemed to swallow all hope and light.
meanings.sent5: The squalidest conditions in the prison made even the toughest inmates cringe.

meanings.definition: In a very bad or poor condition.
meanings.sent1: The old car was in the squalidest state, barely running and covered in rust.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, the roads were squalidest with potholes and debris.
meanings.sent3: The squalidest tent at the camping site collapsed in the middle of the night.
meanings.sent4: His squalidest attempt at cooking resulted in a burnt mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The squalidest building in town was an eyesore to all who passed by.

meanings.definition: Characterized by filth, squalor, or degradation.
meanings.sent1: The squalidest motel in town had a reputation for bedbugs and mold.
meanings.sent2: The basement of the old house was the squalidest area, filled with cobwebs and dust.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, the squalidest corners of the room remained untouched.
meanings.sent4: The squalidest thoughts crept into his mind during moments of despair.
meanings.sent5: The squalidest part of the park was avoided by all the visitors.
